page.title: 01East Lothian Farmland
page.content: The area is predominately agricultural with a mixture of large farms like the Byres, Harperdean & Alderston mains and smaller holdings. Crops grown on the larger farms include wheat, barley and vegetables. eg. Potatoes, leeks, cabbages etc which are cultivated on a large scale at West Garleton but also by smaler units around Camptoun. A certain amount of dairy farming is carried on with Alderston supporting 120 head of cattle plus growing cereals, potatoes & other vegetable crops for animal feed. The upland area is used for grazing both beef cattle and sheep. A major quarrying operation has been carried out at Bangley near Huntington for 50 years. Manager Bob Keenan explained that expansion in recent years meant that 0.25 million tons of crushed trachite are extracted annually for use in road building.
